text: Christopher Benjamin (27 December 1934 - 15 January 2025) was an English actor with many stage and television credits since the 1960s. His television roles include three appearances in Doctor Who, portraying Sir Keith Gold in Inferno (1970), Henry Gordon Jago in The Talons of Weng-Chiang (1977) and Colonel Hugh Curbishley in "The Unicorn and the Wasp" (2008). He also provided the voice of Rowf in the animated film The Plague Dogs (1982).Profile, behindthevoiceactors.com; accessed 23 January 2016. Benjamin died on 15 January 2025, at the age of 90. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Actors from Yorkshire Category:English movie actors Category:English stage actors Category:English television actors
title: Christopher Benjamin
